any of those rights guaranteed to the individual by the Constitution of the Republic of India as the right to vote, equal treatment of all people with respect to the enjoyment of life, liberty, and property and to the protection of law, liberty to follow one's religion, right to express one's opinion, etc.; a civil right.

an idol of a deified cobra, installed for purpose of worshipping.

a serpent-shaped ornament worn by women on their head. ನಾಗರ ಅಮಾವಾಸ್ಯೆ nāgara amāvāsye the new moon-day ināṣāḍha, the fourth month of Hindu lunar calendar; ನಾಗರ ಅಮಾಸಿ nāgara anāsu = ನಾಗರ ಅಮಾವಾಸ್ಯೆ; ನಾಗರ ಕಲ್ಲು nāgara kallu = ನಾಗರು - 2; ನಾಗರ ಕಾಟ nāgara kāṭa any of several diseases (as abscess, scabies, etc.) supposed to have been caused by one's commitment of an offence to a serpent-god; 2. infertility or non-conceiving of children caused by the supposed curse of a serpent god; ನಾಗರ ಕಾಯಿ nāgara kāyi the fruit of the tree Tamarindus indica; tamarind; ನಾಗರ ಚೌತಿ nāgara cauti = ನಾಗಚತುರ್ಥಿ; ನಾಗರ ಪಂಚಮಿ nāgara pancami = ನಾಗಪಂಚಮಿ; ನಾಗರ ಪಣೆ nāgara paṇe a serpent-hood shaped ear-ornament; ನಾಗರ ಬೆತ್ತ nāgara betta = ನಾಗಬೆತ್ತ; ನಾಗರ ರಾಗಟೆ nāgara rāgaṭe = ನಾಗರು - 3; ನಾಗರ ಸುತ್ತು nāgara suttu = ನಾಗಮುರಿ - 1; ನಾಗರ ಹಾವು nāgara hāvu = ನಾಗರು - 1.

he who is not at ease with other people or is extremely self-conscious; a bashful boy or man; a shyer.

the quality of being - a) pleasing in its lightness, mildness, subtlety, etc.; b) slight and subtle, c) easily damaged, spoiled or disordered, d) frail in health; e) needing careful handling, tact, etc., f) finely sensitive in feeling, understanding, discriminating or responding, g) finely skilled, h) sensitive or disagreeable to what is considered offensive or improper.

ನಾಡಿ ಆಡು nāḍiāḍu (an artery) to beat regularly and rhythmically (at certain points of the body); ನಾಡಿ ಆಡದವ ಓಡಿ ಬಂದಾನೆ? nāḍiāḍādava ōḍi bandāne (prov.) a dead is dead, will never come back; ನಾಡಿ ನಿಂತ ಮೇಲೆ ಕಾಡ ಪಾಲು nāḍi ninta mēle kāḍa pālu (prov.) no one will follow the dead person; ನಾಡಿ ನೋಡು nāḍi nōḍu to check the rate and rhythmicity of the pulse-beating; ನಾಡಿ ನೋಡದೆ ಮದ್ದುಕೊಟ್ಟರೆ ಕಾಡುರೋಗ ಬರುವುದು nāḍi nōḍade maddu koṭṭare kāḍurōga baruvudu diagnose the disease before treating it; ನಾಡಿ ಮಿಡಿ nāḍi miḍi = ನಾಡಿ ಆಡು; ನಾಡಿ ಮಿಡಿತ nāḍi miḍita the regular beating in the arteries, caused by the contractions of the heart; 2. practical knowledge of underlying feelings of the public or a particular situation; ನಾಡಿ ಹುಣ್ಣು nāḍi huṇṇu = ನಾಡಿ1 - 6.

ನಾಡ ಕಥೆ nāḍa kathe a story handed down for generations among a people whose historicity is not verifiable; a legend; ನಾಡಕರಣಿ nāḍa karaṇi the leader of a people. 2. a family name used in Karnāṭaka and Mahārāṣṭra; ನಾಡ ಖೋಡಿ nāḍa khōḍi a villain who is notoriously known all over the region; ನಾಡ ಗಾದೆ nāḍa gāde a widely-known, short popular saying, usu. of unknown and ancient origin, that expresses effectively some commonplace truth or useful thought; an adage; a proverb; ನಾಡ ಗೀತೆ nāḍa gīte a song of praise or devotion to a nation, state or region; an anthem; 2. the official song of a state, region or nation; ನಾಡ ಗೌಡ nāḍa gauḍa the chief of a region, state; ನಾಡ ಚಲ್ಲವತ್ತ nāḍa callavatta a man who breaks faith with or fails to meet the confidence placed on him; a betrayer; ನಾಡ ಜನ nāḍa jana the common people of a state or nation; ನಾಡ ದೇವಿ nāḍa dēvi the presiding female deity of a country or state; 2. Bhuvanēśvari, the presiding Goddess of Karnāṭaka; ನಾಡ ದೈವ nāḍa daiva the presiding deity of a country or state; 2. any petty god; ನಾಡ ದಡ್ಡಿ nāḍa daḍḍi a stupid woman; ನಾಡ ನುಡಿ nāḍa nuḍi = ನಾಡ ಗಾದೆ; 2. the main language of a state or country; 3. indecent, abusive language or speech; ನಾಡ ಮದ್ದು nāḍa maddu any medicine made from the traditional knowledge handed over from generation to generation, esp. without using chemical substances; ನಾಡ ಮಾತು nāḍa mātu = ನಾಡ ಗಾದೆ; 2. news relating to a state, general public, etc.; 2.3. general and casual talking; ನಾಡ ಮುಖ nāḍa mukha a leader of the people of a country or state; ನಾಡ ವಾರ್ತೆ nāḍa vārte news relating to a state, general public, etc.; 2. general or casual talking; ನಾಡ ಹಬ್ಬ nāḍa habba the state festival of a state-country, observed by people of all religions, creed, etc.; ನಾಡ ಹಾಡು nāḍa hāḍu = ನಾಡ ಗೀತೆ; ನಾಡ ಹಾದಿ nāḍa hādi a path or road of imperfect construction; ನಾಡ ಹುಚ್ಚ nāḍa hucca an absolutely foolish man; ನಾಡ ಹುಚ್ಚಿ nāḍa hucci an absolutely foolish woman; ನಾಡ ಬೀಡುಗ nāḍa bīḍuga a common man.
